intro: Dissotis djalonis, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers with prominent, petal-like bracts. The plant typically grows in wet, marshy areas and has a creeping rhizome system that helps it spread across wetlands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while the flowers bloom in clusters at the ends of the stems. Dissotis djalonis plays an important role in its ecosystem by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
